qa_pairs.question: How to setup guest network
qa_pairs.answer: Go to your router’s web interface or ASUS Router App, go to [Network] > Guest Portal, enter the required settings, and click Apply to finish. [metadata]id=10024,desc=wifi_setting[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: How do I change admin name and password?
qa_pairs.answer: Go to your router’s web interface or ASUS Router App, go to [Administration] > System, and change the Admin Name and Password. Click Apply to save the changes.

qa_pairs.question: When I use the router’s built-in Speedtest, it shows only 100 Mbps, but when I test on my computer, I get 500 Mbps. What could be the possible reasons?
qa_pairs.answer: The router’s built-in speed test is mainly for quick checks and may show lower results due to how the router processes data and interacts with test servers. This does not mean your network performance is limited. For the most accurate results, we recommend running Speedtest on your computer or mobile device to better reflect real-world usage.

qa_pairs.question: How do I set up a VPN server on my ASUS router?
qa_pairs.answer: To set up a VPN server on your ASUS router, first connect your computer to the router via wired or WiFi and log in to the web GUI at http://www.asusrouter.com using your username and password. Navigate to [VPN Server], then select the desired VPN protocol (e.g., OpenVPN or PPTP) and click the enable button. For general devices, click [Apply] to save the configuration. To export the configuration profile, click the Export button. For mobile devices, download the appropriate VPN client app and import the configuration file. For other devices, export the profile file and import it into the VPN client.

qa_pairs.question: How to setup vpn network?
qa_pairs.answer: Go to your router’s web interface or ASUS Router App, open Network → VPN Network, enter your VPN settings, and apply them so that devices connected to this SSID will automatically use the VPN connection.

qa_pairs.question: How can I block access to popular adult websites such as Pornhub, XVideos, XHamster, RedTube, YouPorn, OnlyFans, Brazzers, BangBros, NaughtyAmerica, and RealityKings on my network?”
qa_pairs.answer: Navigate to [Parental Controls] > [Web & Apps Filters], enable Web & Apps Filters, add a device and select the filter, Click Apply to save the settings. If you wan to block the whole network, suggest to navigate to WAN > DNS setting > assign DNS like adguard or control D to filter adult sites.

qa_pairs.question: What is gear accelerator?
qa_pairs.answer: This model do not support gear accelerator, please use adaptive QoE to optimize your network performance.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my router send an AiDetection notification through the app saying that the LAN port is connected, then suddenly disconnect twice, and then reconnect again?
qa_pairs.answer: Some network adapter models may encounter similar issues. You can follow these steps in Windows: Go to Device Manager > Network adapters > right-click your USB Realtek Ethernet adapter and select Properties > open the Power Management tab > uncheck “Allow the computer to turn off this device to save power” > click OK.

qa_pairs.question: What is WTFast?
qa_pairs.answer: This model do not support WTFast, please use adaptive QoE to optimize your network performance.

qa_pairs.question: How many apps could be filtered in Content filter of GT-BE19000AI?
qa_pairs.answer: Up to 161 apps.

qa_pairs.question: Why doesn’t the parental control time scheduling feature work as expected?
qa_pairs.answer: Make sure the parental control schedule is set correctly, check if “Private Address/Randomized MAC” is disabled on your child’s device, update the router firmware, and restart the router if needed.

qa_pairs.question: Please block unknown devices from connecting.
qa_pairs.answer: To block unknown devices from connecting to your ASUS router, you can enable MAC filtering. go to [Network], select the specific network (such as Main Network, Kid’s Network, IoT Network, or Guest Network), then enable MAC Filter. Add the MAC addresses of the devices you want to allow or block, and apply the settings. This will prevent unauthorized devices from connecting to your network.[metadata]id=10024,desc=wifi_setting[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Which devices are currently connected to my WiFi?
qa_pairs.answer: To view the devices currently connected to your ASUS router, log in to the router's web interface and navigate to the 'Network Map' or 'Client List' section. This will display a list of all devices connected to your network, along with their IP addresses and MAC addresses.[metadata]id=10012,desc=get_client_num[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Please limit the network speed of a specific computer.
qa_pairs.answer: To limit the network speed of a specific computer connected to your ASUS router, log in to the router's web interface and navigate to the adaptive QoE > Bandwidth limiter section. From there, you can identify the device you want to limit and set a maximum bandwidth limit for it. This will help manage the network speed for that specific device.

qa_pairs.question: What unique functions does this machine offer?
qa_pairs.answer: This machine offers several unique functions, including advanced parental controls, adaptive QoE for optimized performance, WiFi insight, AiBoard play ground for poweer users. These capabilities allow users to customize their network experience and ensure a secure and efficient online environment.

qa_pairs.question: there is an unknown device connecting to my wifi?
qa_pairs.answer: To address an unknown device connecting to your WiFi, you can take the following steps: 1. Log in to your router's web interface. 2. Navigate to the 'Client List' section to identify the device. 3. If you want to block the device, enable MAC filtering and add the device's MAC address to the block list. 4. Consider changing your WiFi password and enabling WPA3 encryption for better security.

qa_pairs.question: What is my aiboard ip address?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find it at System Log > DHCP lease.[metadata]id=10033,desc=get_aiboard_ip[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Can I run a wifi performance test now?
qa_pairs.answer: Suggest to make sure firmware is up to date, and trun off unnecessary functions e.g. AiProtection, QoE, Parental control, VPN server/client, etc. before running the test. [metadata]id=10013,desc=firmware_update[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: what is your version?
qa_pairs.answer: [metadata]id=10020,desc=get_firmware_version[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: How much percentage the energy saving mode could save?
qa_pairs.answer: It's up to 30% energy saving when the energy saving mode is enabled. But the actual saving percentage may vary based on usage and environment.

qa_pairs.question: How to enable wifi insight?
qa_pairs.answer: You might go to Dashboard > WiFi insights to check if there is interference from other devices.

qa_pairs.question: what is signature version?
qa_pairs.answer: The signature version is the database version of the AiProtection feature, which helps protect your network from threats.

qa_pairs.question: Should I disable auto firmware upgrade?
qa_pairs.answer: Disabling auto firmware upgrade may prevent your router from receiving important security updates and new features. It's generally recommended to keep it enabled for optimal performance and security.

qa_pairs.question: What is traffic analyzer?
qa_pairs.answer: Traffic Analyzer is a feature that provides insights into your network traffic, allowing you to monitor bandwidth usage, identify bandwidth hogs, and optimize your network performance.

qa_pairs.question: WPS?
qa_pairs.answer: WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) is a network security standard that allows users to easily secure a wireless home network. It enables devices to connect to the network without needing to enter a password, typically by pressing a button on the router. By default it's disabled for security reasons, but you can enable it in the router settings if needed.

qa_pairs.question: what is aura rgb?
qa_pairs.answer: ASUS Gaming Routers support Aura RGB LED light effects and allow users to customize the lighting effects to perfectly complement their gaming rig.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find user manual?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find the user manual on the official ASUS support website. Go to [ASUS Support](https://www.asus.com/support/) and search for your router model to access the manual and other resources.

qa_pairs.question: What is AiProtection?
qa_pairs.answer: AiProtection is a security feature integrated into ASUS routers that provides advanced protection against online threats. It includes features like malicious site blocking, two-way IPS (Intrusion Prevention System), tracker block and ad block to help keep your network safe.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find FAQ?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find the FAQ on the official ASUS support website. Go to [ASUS Support](https://www.asus.com/support/) and search for your router model to access the FAQ and other resources.

qa_pairs.question: I don't know what to ask?
qa_pairs.answer: You can take a deep breath and ask later if you have any question come in mind.

qa_pairs.question: I have no question to ask?
qa_pairs.answer: You can take a deep breath and ask later if you have any question come in mind.

qa_pairs.question: What is my wifi status, any interference?
qa_pairs.answer: [metadata]id=10028,desc=wifi_txop_status[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Will you support merlin asuswrt or merlin firmware?
qa_pairs.answer: We will do our best to support asuswrt and merlin firmware, but we cannot guarantee full compatibility with all features. Please refer to the Merlin official site for more information.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find asus router tutorial videos?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find tutorial videos here: [ASUS Support] (https://www.youtube.com/@asus_support).

qa_pairs.question: What is the best feature of the asus ai router?
qa_pairs.answer: WiFi insight is one of them, which could real-time detect the wifi interference from other devices, and help you to find the best channel for your wifi network. It could also detect interferences from outband devices such as microwave oven, bluetooth devices, wireless camera, etc.

qa_pairs.question: Why I am not able to upgrade firmware manually via web?
qa_pairs.answer: Make sure the firmware file is correct for your router model, check your internet connection, clear your browser cache, try a different browser, and ensure you have sufficient storage space on the router(Maybe turn off traffic analyzer and AiProtection temporarily). If the issue persists, consider a factory reset.

qa_pairs.question: Why keyword or url filter not working properly?
qa_pairs.answer: Make sure the keyword or URL is correctly entered, check for any typos, and ensure that the filter settings are properly configured. If the issue persists, you might consider to use AdGuard DNS or Control D to filter the unwanted sites.

qa_pairs.question: How to use ad guard dns or control d to filter unwanted sites?
qa_pairs.answer: AdGuard DNS is a Domain Name System (DNS) service that offers ad-blocking and privacy protection features. AdGuard DNS works by filtering out requests to known advertising, tracking, and malware domains at the DNS level, before a connection is even established. This helps to block ads and prevent your device from loading potentially harmful content. You can find more details at [ASUS FAQ](https://www.asus.com/support/faq/1051213/)

qa_pairs.question: Can I use ipv6(IPv6) with the router?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can use IPv6 with the router. Make sure your ISP supports IPv6 and that you have enabled it in the router settings. For more details, please refer to: [ASUS IPv6 FAQ](https://www.asus.com/support/faq/113990/)

qa_pairs.question: What is ROG first (rog first)?
qa_pairs.answer: Are you an ROG user? If so, your ROG gears will be first priority on this router.

qa_pairs.question: What is gtnet?
qa_pairs.answer: GTnet is a new game acceleration technology. It optimizes network traffic for gaming applications, reducing latency and improving overall gaming performance.

qa_pairs.question: What is GTnet?
qa_pairs.answer: GTnet is a new game acceleration technology. It optimizes network traffic for gaming applications, reducing latency and improving overall gaming performance.

qa_pairs.question: What is gameboost?
qa_pairs.answer: Game boost is now upgrade to adaptive QoE, which uses AI traffic analysis to identify and classify gaming, streaming, and remote work traffic, dynamically allocates bandwidth to prioritize critical tasks, reduces latency and packet loss, and automatically adjusts optimization strategies for smooth multi-device performance, ideal for high-traffic homes, gamers, and remote work scenarios.

qa_pairs.question: Can I change to dark theme?
qa_pairs.answer: Not supported yet, but maybe later.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between a modem and a router?
qa_pairs.answer: A modem connects your home to the Internet from your ISP, while a router distributes that Internet to devices through Wi-Fi or Ethernet.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between Wi-Fi 5, Wi-Fi 6, and Wi-Fi 7?
qa_pairs.answer: Wi-Fi 5 is older with slower speed and higher latency, Wi-Fi 6 adds OFDMA and better multi-device performance, while Wi-Fi 7 supports 320 MHz channels, 4096-QAM, and Multi-Link Operation for faster, more stable connections.

qa_pairs.question: Why does Wi-Fi speed drop when moving farther from the router?
qa_pairs.answer: Wi-Fi signals weaken over distance and are absorbed or blocked by walls, floors, and furniture, causing lower speed and weaker coverage.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of dual-band or tri-band routers?
qa_pairs.answer: Dual-band routers broadcast on 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz, while tri-band routers add another band (5 or 6 GHz) to reduce congestion and improve performance.

qa_pairs.question: Why do 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks have different ranges?
qa_pairs.answer: 2.4 GHz travels farther and penetrates walls better, while 5 GHz has faster speeds but shorter range due to higher frequency signals.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between MU-MIMO and OFDMA?
qa_pairs.answer: MU-MIMO allows multiple devices to receive data simultaneously, while OFDMA divides a Wi-Fi channel into smaller sub-channels for efficient use with many devices.

qa_pairs.question: Why is Ethernet faster than Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Ethernet uses a wired connection with less interference and lower latency, while Wi-Fi is wireless and can be affected by distance, obstacles, and other devices.

qa_pairs.question: What is a Wi-Fi dead zone?
qa_pairs.answer: A dead zone is an area in your home where the Wi-Fi signal is too weak or blocked, often caused by distance, walls, or interference.

qa_pairs.question: What are common sources of Wi-Fi interference?
qa_pairs.answer: Microwaves, cordless phones, Bluetooth devices, and neighboring Wi-Fi networks can all cause interference that reduces speed and stability.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of WPA3 compared to WPA2?
qa_pairs.answer: WPA3 provides stronger encryption, better protection against password guessing, and improved security for IoT devices compared to WPA2.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi sometimes disconnect when the microwave is on?
qa_pairs.answer: Microwaves operate near the 2.4 GHz frequency, which can interfere with Wi-Fi signals on the same band, causing temporary disconnections.

qa_pairs.question: What is beamforming in Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Beamforming is a technology that directs Wi-Fi signals toward your device instead of broadcasting equally in all directions, improving speed and range.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between IPv4 and IPv6?
qa_pairs.answer: IPv4 uses 32-bit addresses and is running out of space, while IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses, providing many more unique IPs and better future scalability.

qa_pairs.question: What is QoS on a router?
qa_pairs.answer: Quality of Service (QoS) lets you prioritize traffic for certain devices or apps, such as gaming or streaming, to reduce lag and buffering.

qa_pairs.question: Why is Wi-Fi faster on my phone but slower on my laptop?
qa_pairs.answer: Device Wi-Fi chips differ in speed and supported standards, and laptops may use older adapters or have weaker antennas compared to modern smartphones.

qa_pairs.question: Why is my Wi-Fi slower at night?
qa_pairs.answer: Internet speeds can slow down at night because more people in your neighborhood are online, causing congestion on your ISP network.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my phone switch between Wi-Fi and mobile data?
qa_pairs.answer: Your phone may detect weak Wi-Fi signals or unstable connections and automatically switch to mobile data for a more reliable connection.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of using 6 GHz Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: 6 GHz Wi-Fi (Wi-Fi 6E/7) offers cleaner spectrum with less interference, wider channels, and lower latency compared to 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz.

qa_pairs.question: Why do some devices only see the 2.4 GHz network?
qa_pairs.answer: Older devices or IoT devices may only support 2.4 GHz, which has wider compatibility but slower speeds.

qa_pairs.question: What is a router firmware update?
qa_pairs.answer: A firmware update improves performance, fixes bugs, adds security patches, and sometimes unlocks new features for your router.

qa_pairs.question: Why is my Wi-Fi speed different from a speed test on Ethernet?
qa_pairs.answer: Ethernet is more stable and less affected by interference, while Wi-Fi can be slower due to distance, obstacles, and wireless congestion.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between SSID and password?
qa_pairs.answer: SSID is the Wi-Fi network name, while the password (security key) is used to connect devices securely to that network.

qa_pairs.question: Why do I see multiple Wi-Fi networks with the same name?
qa_pairs.answer: This can happen if you have AiMesh nodes, extenders, or nearby networks using the same SSID. Your device may switch between them based on signal strength.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of turning off Wi-Fi when not in use?
qa_pairs.answer: Turning off Wi-Fi saves power, reduces interference, and may improve security when the network is not needed.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my smart TV buffer when streaming?
qa_pairs.answer: Streaming buffers if the Wi-Fi signal is weak, the ISP speed is too low, or other devices are using bandwidth at the same time.

qa_pairs.question: What is NAT type and why does it matter for gaming?
qa_pairs.answer: NAT (Network Address Translation) type affects how easily your console connects to other players. Open NAT is best for gaming, while Strict NAT can limit multiplayer connections.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between static IP and dynamic IP?
qa_pairs.answer: A static IP never changes and is set manually, while a dynamic IP is automatically assigned by the ISP and may change over time.

qa_pairs.question: What is DNS and why should I change it?
qa_pairs.answer: DNS (Domain Name System) translates website names into IP addresses. Switching to a faster or more reliable DNS server can improve browsing speed and stability.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of link aggregation on a router?
qa_pairs.answer: Link aggregation combines two LAN ports into one logical connection, providing higher throughput and redundancy for devices like NAS servers.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between a trunk port and an access port?
qa_pairs.answer: A trunk port carries multiple VLANs with tags, often between network devices. An access port carries traffic for a single VLAN, usually for end-user devices.

qa_pairs.question: What is ping and why is it important?
qa_pairs.answer: Ping measures the time it takes for data to travel to a server and back. Low ping means less delay, which is critical for gaming and video calls.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my router have a QoS setting?
qa_pairs.answer: QoS (Quality of Service) lets you prioritize traffic for gaming, streaming, or work applications, reducing lag and buffering when the network is busy.

qa_pairs.question: What is channel bonding in Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Channel bonding combines two or more channels into one wider channel, increasing Wi-Fi speed but also making it more sensitive to interference.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between IPv4 NAT and IPv6?
qa_pairs.answer: IPv4 NAT shares one public IP among many devices, while IPv6 gives each device a unique public IP, reducing the need for NAT and improving direct connectivity.

qa_pairs.question: What is bufferbloat and how does it affect gaming?
qa_pairs.answer: Bufferbloat happens when routers or modems hold too much data in buffers, causing high latency. It can lead to lag spikes in gaming and video calls.[metadata]id=10004,desc=qos_game_mode_on[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Why can’t my smart bulb connect to Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Most smart bulbs only support 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, so make sure your phone and router are on the 2.4 GHz band when setting them up.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my smart plug keep disconnecting?
qa_pairs.answer: Smart plugs can disconnect if placed too far from the router, or if there is heavy interference. Try moving it closer or adding a mesh node.To diable 802.11b might also help.[metadata]id=10002,desc=11b_disable[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Why does my IP camera not show up on Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: IP cameras may require manual setup or 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi. Check if MAC filtering is enabled on your router and disable it during setup. To diable 802.11b might also help.[metadata]id=10002,desc=11b_disable[/metadata]

qa_pairs.question: Why does my smart home device only work near the router?
qa_pairs.answer: Many IoT devices have weak antennas and work better on 2.4 GHz. Use a mesh system or extender to improve coverage further away.

qa_pairs.question: Why can’t I add my new smart device to the network?
qa_pairs.answer: Check if your network is hidden, using WPA3-only security, or separated into multiple SSIDs. Some IoT devices only support WPA2 and visible SSIDs.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my robot vacuum lose Wi-Fi connection?
qa_pairs.answer: Robot vacuums often switch rooms and may move out of Wi-Fi range. Ensure your mesh coverage is strong in all areas the vacuum travels.

qa_pairs.question: Why can’t my smart home hub find devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Make sure both the hub and devices are on the same Wi-Fi band and subnet. If the hub is wired, confirm it is connected to the same network as Wi-Fi clients.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my smart TV buffer while streaming?
qa_pairs.answer: Smart TVs need stable bandwidth. Use 5 GHz Wi-Fi or a wired Ethernet connection for smoother streaming performance.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my smart speaker stop responding sometimes?
qa_pairs.answer: Smart speakers may lose connection if Wi-Fi is congested. Try assigning them a static IP or place them closer to the router.

qa_pairs.question: What’s the best Wi-Fi band for smart home devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Most IoT devices work better on 2.4 GHz due to longer range, while high-bandwidth devices like cameras or TVs benefit from 5 GHz or 6 GHz.

qa_pairs.question: What should I do if my router keeps rebooting randomly?
qa_pairs.answer: Unstable power, overheating, or outdated firmware can cause reboots. Make sure ventilation is good, update firmware, and try a different power adapter.

qa_pairs.question: Why is my Wi-Fi very slow even when no one is using it?
qa_pairs.answer: Background updates, interference, or ISP issues may slow it down. Restart the router, switch Wi-Fi channels, and test with a wired connection to confirm.

qa_pairs.question: Why do my devices disconnect from Wi-Fi frequently?
qa_pairs.answer: Frequent disconnections can be caused by weak signal, interference, or outdated drivers. Move closer to the router, update firmware, and separate 2.4/5 GHz bands if needed.

qa_pairs.question: Why can’t I log in to the router at 192.168.1.1?
qa_pairs.answer: Many ASUS routers use 192.168.50.1 or asusrouter.com instead. Ensure your device is connected to the router network before logging in.

qa_pairs.question: Why is my Wi-Fi fine but I can’t access some websites?
qa_pairs.answer: The problem may be DNS-related. Try switching to a public DNS server like Google (8.8.8.8) or Cloudflare (1.1.1.1).

qa_pairs.question: Why is my router overheating?
qa_pairs.answer: Routers can overheat if placed in closed spaces. Ensure ventilation holes are clear and place it in a well-ventilated, open area.

qa_pairs.question: Why do video calls keep dropping on Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Video calls are sensitive to latency and packet loss. Use 5 GHz Wi-Fi, enable QoS for conferencing apps, or connect via Ethernet for stability.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi work but Ethernet is not working?
qa_pairs.answer: Ethernet issues may come from faulty cables, disabled LAN ports, or incorrect network settings. Try a different cable and confirm ports are enabled.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi disappear after a few minutes?
qa_pairs.answer: This may happen if the router firmware is corrupted or the device is unstable. Restart the router, update firmware, or reset to factory defaults.

qa_pairs.question: What is DFS channel and why does my 5 GHz Wi-Fi disconnect when using it?
qa_pairs.answer: DFS (Dynamic Frequency Selection) channels overlap with radar systems. Routers must pause Wi-Fi briefly to scan for radar, which can cause disconnections. Using non-DFS channels like 36–48 avoids this.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi 6 router sometimes feel slower than Wi-Fi 5?
qa_pairs.answer: Wi-Fi 6 is optimized for many devices with OFDMA and MU-MIMO. If you only have a few older clients, they may not benefit, and overhead can sometimes reduce peak speed compared to Wi-Fi 5.

qa_pairs.question: What is double NAT and why is it a problem for gaming?
qa_pairs.answer: Double NAT happens when both your ISP modem/router and your own router are doing NAT. This can block port forwarding and cause Strict NAT in games. Putting the ISP modem in bridge mode fixes it.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi speed drop when using VPN on the router?
qa_pairs.answer: Running a VPN on the router encrypts traffic for all devices, which is CPU intensive. Router hardware may not match device-level VPN speeds, causing lower throughput.

qa_pairs.question: Why do some devices have high latency even with good Wi-Fi signal?
qa_pairs.answer: High latency can be caused by bufferbloat, poor QoS settings, or interference. Tools like SQM (Smart Queue Management) or Adaptive QoS can reduce ping spikes.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between 160 MHz and 80 MHz channels?
qa_pairs.answer: 160 MHz doubles Wi-Fi bandwidth compared to 80 MHz, giving higher speeds. But it’s more sensitive to interference and not all clients support it.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my mesh node have weak backhaul speed?
qa_pairs.answer: If nodes connect wirelessly on a congested band, backhaul performance drops. Using Ethernet backhaul or placing nodes closer improves stability.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of assigning static IPs to devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Static IPs prevent devices from changing addresses, useful for port forwarding, servers, printers, and smart home devices that need a fixed network location.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my router show high CPU usage?
qa_pairs.answer: High CPU usage can come from heavy VPN encryption, AiProtection scans, or too many concurrent connections. Check logs, disable unused features, or upgrade hardware.

qa_pairs.question: Why is my download speed fast but upload speed slow on Wi-Fi?
qa_pairs.answer: Upload is more sensitive to interference and weaker antennas. Some ISPs also limit upload speeds. Using 5 GHz or wired Ethernet can improve it.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my Wi-Fi drop when using Bluetooth headphones?
qa_pairs.answer: Both 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi and Bluetooth share spectrum. Heavy Bluetooth use can interfere with Wi-Fi. Switching devices to 5 GHz reduces the conflict.

qa_pairs.question: What is VLAN tagging and why do ISPs require it sometimes?
qa_pairs.answer: Some ISPs use VLAN IDs to separate services like Internet, IPTV, or VoIP. The router must tag packets with the correct VLAN ID to access the Internet properly.

qa_pairs.question: Why do I see high jitter in speed tests even with good bandwidth?
qa_pairs.answer: High jitter means unstable latency, often caused by congestion, bufferbloat, or interference. Enabling QoS and using wired connections can help.

qa_pairs.question: Why does my router reboot when I run P2P or torrents?
qa_pairs.answer: P2P creates thousands of connections, which can overload router memory or NAT tables. Enabling NAT acceleration or using a higher-end router helps.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between WPA2-PSK and WPA2-Enterprise?
qa_pairs.answer: WPA2-PSK uses a shared Wi-Fi password, while WPA2-Enterprise uses a RADIUS server to authenticate each device individually, offering stronger security for business use.

qa_pairs.question: What is iptv and how to setup?
qa_pairs.answer: iptv (Internet Protocol Television) delivers TV content over the internet. To set it up, go to  [LAN] > [IPTV], select your ISP profile or enter custom settings(if required), and apply. Connect your IPTV device to the designated LAN port if required.

qa_pairs.question: Can I use IPTV services through a WiFi network?
qa_pairs.answer: Generally, most IPTV STB (Set-up-box) need to connect cable to establish the IPTV connection, so the setting through cable is must in this case. However, if your IPTV service provider supports WiFi connection, you can connect the IPTV device to your WiFi network. Please check with your IPTV service provider for more details.

qa_pairs.question: Is ASUS router secure and safe?
qa_pairs.answer: ASUS routers come with various security features, including WPA3 encryption, AiProtection, and regular firmware updates. However, users should also take precautions like changing default passwords and disabling WPS.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I change my default router password?
qa_pairs.answer: Default passwords are easy for attackers to guess. Changing to a strong, unique password helps protect your home network from unauthorized access.

qa_pairs.question: Should I disable WPS on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. WPS (Wi-Fi Protected Setup) is convenient but vulnerable to brute-force attacks. Disabling it increases Wi-Fi security.

qa_pairs.question: Why is WPA3 better than WPA2?
qa_pairs.answer: WPA3 provides stronger encryption, protection against password cracking, and better security for IoT devices compared to WPA2.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of using a Guest Wi-Fi network?
qa_pairs.answer: Guest Wi-Fi isolates visitors from your main devices, reducing the risk of malware spreading or unauthorized access to your personal files.

qa_pairs.question: Should I keep my router firmware up to date?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. Firmware updates fix security vulnerabilities and improve stability. Outdated firmware can leave your network exposed to attacks.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I disable remote management on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: Remote management allows access to your router from the Internet. If not needed, disabling it prevents hackers from exploiting it.

qa_pairs.question: How can I make my Wi-Fi password stronger?
qa_pairs.answer: Use at least 12 characters with a mix of uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols. Avoid using personal info like birthdays or names.

qa_pairs.question: Should I hide my Wi-Fi SSID?
qa_pairs.answer: Hiding SSID may prevent casual detection but is not a strong security method. WPA2/WPA3 with a strong password is more effective.

qa_pairs.question: Why is it safer to use a wired connection for important devices?
qa_pairs.answer: Wired connections are harder to intercept than wireless signals, making them more secure for sensitive activities like online banking or remote work.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of using a VPN on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: A VPN encrypts all traffic leaving your home network, protecting privacy and making it harder for attackers or ISPs to track your online activity.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I separate IoT devices on a different Wi-Fi network?
qa_pairs.answer: Smart devices often have weaker security. Placing them on a separate IoT or guest network isolates them from your main devices and reduces risk if one is hacked.

qa_pairs.question: What is safe browsing and how does it protect me?
qa_pairs.answer: Safe browsing features block access to known malicious websites and warn users about potential threats, helping to prevent phishing attacks and malware downloads.

qa_pairs.question: Should I enable DoS protection on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes. DoS protection helps detect and block suspicious traffic patterns that could overwhelm your network.

qa_pairs.question: What is MAC address filtering and is it useful for security?
qa_pairs.answer: MAC filtering allows only approved devices to connect, but it is easy to bypass. It should not be the only security measure, but can add a small extra layer.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I disable UPnP on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: UPnP can automatically open ports without your knowledge, which may be exploited by malware. Disabling it reduces attack surface.

qa_pairs.question: What is DPI (Deep Packet Inspection) and how does it help security?
qa_pairs.answer: DPI examines network traffic beyond headers, allowing the router to detect malware, intrusions, or policy violations more accurately.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I monitor connected devices regularly?
qa_pairs.answer: Unknown or unexpected devices may indicate someone has gained access to your Wi-Fi. Regular monitoring helps detect intrusions early.

qa_pairs.question: What is a VPN kill switch and why is it important?
qa_pairs.answer: A VPN kill switch blocks Internet traffic if the VPN connection drops, preventing unencrypted data from leaking outside your secure tunnel.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I change the router’s default admin username?
qa_pairs.answer: Attackers know common default usernames like 'admin'. Changing it makes brute-force attacks harder.

qa_pairs.question: What is the benefit of enabling a firewall on my router?
qa_pairs.answer: A firewall filters incoming and outgoing traffic, blocking unauthorized access attempts and reducing exposure to online threats.

qa_pairs.question: How to update aiboard firmware?
qa_pairs.answer: Navigate to aiboard > Firmware upgrade > check upgrade. Aiboard firmware upgrade will take longer, please be patient.

qa_pairs.question: Aiboard update failed?
qa_pairs.answer: Try to reset aiboard by pressing [reset] button on aiboard gui. And aiboard will reinstall firmware. It will take longer to reinstall firmware, please be patient.

qa_pairs.question: WiFi is slow, signal is weak in toilet, bathroom and lavatory, how to fix?
qa_pairs.answer: Use a Wi-Fi extender or mesh system to improve coverage in weak signal areas.

qa_pairs.question: How to make my father or mother don't know I'm using internet?
qa_pairs.answer: As I router assistant, I can only help with network-related issues, not personal ones, sorry.

qa_pairs.question: Is my AiMesh node placement good enough to look after all currently connected devices? How else can I improve it?
qa_pairs.answer: You might check the signal quality in AiMesh page (or topology on app), if all lines between mesh nodes are green, it means the placement is good. To ensure optimal coverage, place AiMesh nodes in open areas, away from obstructions.

qa_pairs.question: Am I already using the most optimal setting to achieve maximum performance? Is there anything else I can do to push the performance any higher?
qa_pairs.answer: Basically the default settings are optimized for most scenarios. You can enable adaptive QoE to prioritize gaming or streaming traffic. Also, ensure your firmware is up to date and consider using wired connections for high-bandwidth devices.

qa_pairs.question: List all device in my network that is experiencing bad reception based on throughput.
qa_pairs.answer: Navigate to client page, sort by signal strength or throughput to identify devices with poor reception.For Wi-Fi signals, RSSI weaker than -75 dBm on 2.4 GHz, -70 dBm on 5 GHz, or -70 dBm on 6 GHz is generally considered poor.(This depends on environment and client device type, just for reference)

qa_pairs.question: What is the TXoP percentage of the WiFi insight means?
qa_pairs.answer: TXoP (Transmit Opportunity Percentage) measures the percentage of time a device has the opportunity to transmit data over the Wi-Fi network. A higher TXoP percentage indicates better network performance and efficiency for that device.TXOP usage below 20% is considered good, 20–50% is acceptable, 50–70% indicates congestion, and above 70% is poor and may cause high latency, jitter, or packet loss. (This for reference only, actual experience may vary based on environment and device capabilities)
